definition: TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598
surname Feng
luxuriant/buxom/variant of 豐|丰[feng1]/variant of 風|风[feng1]/appearance/charm
abundant/plentiful/fertile/plump/great
surname Chen
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: Hideyoshi himself brought along two portable teahouses in starkly contrasting styles.
sentences.chinese: 丰臣秀吉本人带来了两个风格截然不同的便携式茶馆。

sentences.english: Wanli emperor decided was conferring the king of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 万历帝决定册封丰臣秀吉为日本国王。

sentences.english: In Japan, hideyoshi understand Japanese situation in north Korea.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，丰臣秀吉了解了日军在朝鲜的战况。

sentences.english: Hideyoshi was also a great and enthusiastic patron of many arts.
sentences.chinese: 丰臣秀吉同时还是许多艺术的热心赞助人。

sentences.english: In Japan, hideyoshi celebrate son pill was born.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，丰臣秀吉庆贺儿子拾丸诞生。

sentences.english: The invasion of Hideyoshi (Japan) and others led to"The Hermit Kingdom."
sentences.chinese: 日本丰臣秀吉与其他民族入侵这隐士王国。

definition: ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
ASHIKAGA Yoshimitsu (1358-1408), third Ashikaga shogun, reigned 1368-1394
Muromachi bakufu, the feudal government of Japan (1338-1573) under the Ashikaga shoguns
Kamakura bakufu 1192-1333, the first Japanese samurai shogunate
MINAMOTO no Yoritomo (1147-1199), Japanese warlord and founder of the Kamakura shogunate 鐮倉幕府|镰仓幕府[Lian2 cang1 mu4 fu3]
(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
to inform/to notify
Edo (old name of Tokyo)
Owari or Owari-no-kuni, Japanese fiefdom during 11th-15th century, current Aichi prefecture around Nagoya
emperor/emperor of Japan
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
ASHIKAGA Yoshimasa (1435-1490), eighth Ashikaga shōgun, reigned 1449-1473
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
Ōnin war 1467-1477 between factions of Ashikaga shogunate
Yi Seong-gye (1335-1408), founder and first king of Korean Yi dynasty (1392-1910)
Tokugawa, the ruling clan of Japan from 1550-1850
